?def: A technique for calculating free energy differences between states. It involves gradually transforming one state into another along a defined path.@en
Psi4 is an open-source suite of ab initio quantum chemistry programs designed for efficient, high-accuracy simulations of molecular properties.@en
Software used to manipulate and transform data from molecular simulations. This includes programs for filtering, averaging, or reformatting simulation outputs.@en
Software, package, or tools designed specifically for performing statistical analyses and computations.@en
Different forms of energy considered in molecular simulations. These can include bonded interactions (like bond stretching) and non-bonded interactions (like electrostatics).@en
Statistical methods for identifying relationships between variables in simulation data. These can reveal important couplings between different parts of a molecular system.@en
A file describing the connectivity and parameters of atoms in a molecular system. It defines how atoms are bonded and what force field parameters they use.@en
Programs specifically designed to perform molecular dynamics simulations. These solve equations of motion for atoms over time, often using parallel computing techniques.@en
General AMBER force field (gaff) is a Small Organic Molecule Force Field designed for small organic molecules, compatible with AMBER protein force fields.@en
Salt is ionic compounds that separate into cations (positively charged ions) and anions (negatively charged ions) when dissolved in solvent (typically water is used as solvent).@en
Hartree-Fock (HF) is a method of approximation for the determination of the wave function and the energy of a quantum many-body system in a stationary state.@en
A unique identifier assigned to structures in the Protein Data Bank. It typically consists of four alphanumeric characters.@en
Software used to predict the orientation of molecules when they bind to each other. It's commonly used in drug discovery to predict how small molecules interact with protein targets.@en

Standard Error of the Mean (SEM), denoted as σMSE, quantifies the precision of the estimated mean effective binding energy. A smaller SEM indicates a more precise estimate of the true mean. It is calculated by σMSE = s / √n where s is the sample standard deviation of the effective binding energies and n is the number of snapshots considered in the calculation.@en
In molecular dynamics, an input file used to prepare the simulation pipeline and/or file required to perform the simulation.@en
OPM (Orientations of Proteins in Membranes) is a curated database that provides spatial arrangements of membrane proteins relative to the hydrocarbon core of the lipid bilayer.@en
Ion force fields is the force field being used to model ion parameters in simulations.@en
Software designed for a specific use. Examples include programs for structure visualization, trajectory analysis, or free energy calculations.@en

Correlation Coefficient is numerical measure of some type of linear correlation between two variables. It ranges from -1 to +1, where ±1 indicates the strongest possible correlation and 0 indicates no correlation.@en
Bond energy is a measure of the strength of a chemical bond.@en

PMF Method is a computational technique used in molecular dynamics simulations to calculate free energy profiles along a reaction coordinate. PMF provides the free energy profile along a chosen reaction coordinate, allowing researchers to understand the energetics of processes like protein folding, ligand binding, or ion transport, and typically use Umbrella Sampling.@en
A*search algorithm uses heuristics to find the optimal path more efficiently, can be applied to transformation path problems with appropriate heuristics.@en

SHAKE is  type of constraining algorithm that  iteratively adjusting atomic positions to satisfy constraints after each unconstrained update. It uses Lagrange multipliers to enforce constraints and is typically applied to bonds involving hydrogen atoms.@en
MSE calculates the average of signed differences between predicted and experimental values. It is useful for detecting systematic bias in predictions.@en
Measures of the correlation of a signal with itself at different time lags. They're useful for identifying periodic behavior and estimating relaxation times.@en
Membrane protein orienting tool is used for orienting membrane proteins prior to performing molecular dynamics simulations.@en

Protonation ligand state refers to the configuration of a ligand molecule based on the presence or absence of protons on specific atoms, particularly ionizable groups. It affects the ligand's charge distribution and binding properties, influencing its behavior in different pH environments and its interactions with target molecules. The protonation state can significantly affect the ligand's charge distribution and binding properties.@en
Pka Tool  is a tool that predicts the pKa values of ionizable groups in protein at the specified pH.@en
Methods used to compute free energy differences in molecular systems. These calculations are crucial for understanding molecular interactions and chemical processes.@en
A framework is a reusable set of libraries, tools, and conventions for developing software applications.@en
Gaussian is a commercial software used to perform quantum chemistry calculations with various quantum chemical methods implementations.@en
MAE calculates the average of absolute differences between predicted and experimental values. It is less sensitive to outliers compared to RMSE.@en
The process of bringing a system to thermal equilibrium in a simulation. It involves gradually heating the system to the desired temperature.@en

Particle Mesh Ewald Method is a method to handle electrostatic interaction by splitting the potential into short-range and long-range parts. The short-range part is calculated directly, while the long-range part is calculated using Fourier transforms on a grid.@en
Lipid force field is the force field being used to model lipid molecules in simulations.@en
A programming language and environment specifically designed for statistical computing and graphics.@en
Ligand pairs are selected based on chemical similarity.@en

Berendsen barostat is a type of barostat algorithm that yields the correct target density, but it does not strictly sample from the isothermal-isobaric ensemble and typically yields volume fluctuations that are too low.@en

A specialized variant of the Tversky Index that uses fixed parameters with the alpha (α) value of  = 0.95, and beta (β) value of = 0.05 to heavily weight the reference molecule in the comparison. This asymmetric weighting makes it particularly effective at finding molecules that contain the reference structure as a substructure. RefTversky is commonly used in virtual screening to identify compounds that preserve key structural features of a reference molecule.@en
In molecular dynamics, an output file  is a file that is generated at any stage of the computational simulation preparation or any of the preparation stage.@en

Brick-CFCMC is an open-source Monte Carlo simulation software for calculating phase and reaction equilibria. While not primarily designed for similarity calculations, it can be adapted for related thermodynamic integration tasks, offering versatility in computational chemistry applications.@en
Ant colony optimization algorithm is inspired by the behavior of ants finding paths, and can be adapted for finding optimal transformation paths in molecular systems.@en
Network flow algorithm can be used to find optimal paths in weighted graphs, such as Ford-Fulkerson and Edmonds-Karp algorithms.@en
Non-specific interaction energy is the type of interaction described by the chemical  force-fields between two not defined chemical entities.@en
Multi-step approach breaks down the transformation into multiple steps (e.g., separate electrostatic and van der Waals transformations).@en
The process of predicting the preferred orientation of a ligand when bound to a protein. It's widely used in drug discovery to screen potential drug candidates.@en

OpenCalphad is an open-source thermodynamic software package that enables the calculation of phase equilibria, phase diagrams, and various thermophysical properties. Distributed under the GNU license, it is a platform for multi-component equilibrium calculations and can be integrated with other simulation software through its application programming interface.@en

AMBER-FEW is a specialized tool for automating relative binding free energy calculations using thermodynamic integration. It streamlines the setup and execution of transformation simulations, enabling efficient computation of ligand binding affinities with minimal user input.@en

RMSE measures the standard deviation of prediction errors, calculated as the square root of the average of squared differences between predicted and experimental values. It provides an overall measure of prediction accuracy.@en
Specific interaction is the type of interaction described by the chemical  force-fields between two particular and defined chemical entities.@en

Ligand pairs are selected from ligands with reliable experimental binding data (e.g., Ki, IC50, or ΔG values). This ensure the experimental data covers a sufficient dynamic range for statistical analysis.@en

MMPBSA (Molecular Mechanics Poisson-Boltzmann Surface Area) is a computational method for calculating binding free energies between molecules, such as protein-ligand or protein-protein interactions. It combines molecular mechanics calculations with the Poisson-Boltzmann equation for continuum solvation, typically using snapshots from molecular dynamics simulations.@en
Coarse Grained Solvent Model is a solvent model that simplify the representation of solvent molecules, often grouping multiple atoms into a single interaction site.@en
The Generalized Born (GB) model is an approximation method used in molecular dynamics simulations to efficiently model the electrostatic effects of solvent on biomolecules.@en

Bound ligand state is the configuration where the ligand is fully associated with the protein target, occupying a specific binding site. In this state, the ligand forms stable interactions (e.g., hydrogen bonds, van der Waals interactions) with the protein.@en
Convergence Metrics assess whether the simulations have adequately sampled the relevant phase space, such as the Geweke diagnostic or auto-correlation time.@en
Molecular Mechanics Poisson-Boltzmann Surface Area, a method to calculate binding free energies. It combines molecular mechanics energies with continuum solvent models.@en

Unbound ligand state is the configuration where the ligand is completely separated from the protein, typically freely moving in the solvent. In this state, the ligand does not interact directly with the protein.@en
Quasiharmonic mode analyses the estimate entropic contributions due to changes of solute flexibility upon binding.@en
Methods to calculate free energies from non-equilibrium simulations. These can be more efficient than equilibrium methods for some systems.@en
Techniques that involve repeated sampling from a dataset. These include methods like bootstrapping, which can provide estimates of uncertainty in calculated properties.@en
Another modified version of the Bondi radii set. It includes further refinements for use in biomolecular simulations.@en
Programs that can be run directly by a computer in molecular simulations. These are typically compiled from source code and optimized for performance.@en
Water model force field is the force field being used to model water in simulations@en

A similarity measure that specifically compares the chemical features and atom types between molecules, focusing on their functional groups and chemical properties rather than their shape. This measure evaluates the similarity of atomic properties and chemical functionalities between molecules, making it valuable for identifying compounds with similar chemical behavior. It complements shape-based similarity measures in molecular comparison workflows.@en
A file containing the spatial positions of atoms in a molecular system. It's a fundamental input for molecular simulations.@en
DNA force field is the force field being used to model DNAs in simulations.@en
Cross-Validation Errors assess the predictive performance and generalizability of the computational model.@en
Hydrophobic interactions  is a type of non-covalent interaction that is the observed force of non-polar substances to aggregate in an aqueous solution and to be excluded by water.@en

Metastable ligand state is a relatively stable intermediate configurations along the binding pathway that have local energy minima. These states can persist for some time before transitioning to other states.@en
Errors estimated by testing a model on data not used in its creation. This technique helps assess how well a model generalizes to new data.@en
A modified version of the Bondi radii set. It's optimized for use in Generalized Born calculations.@en
A file containing the information needed to continue a simulation from a specific point. It typically includes atomic positions, velocities, and system parameters.@en
A set of atomic radii used in implicit solvent models. These radii are optimized for calculating solvation energies in biomolecular simulations.@en
A method that uses external forces to guide a system along a reaction coordinate. It adapts the applied force based on the system's response.@en
BSE provides confidence intervals for the calculated binding energies. It is useful for assessing the robustness of the calculations.@en
A water model is used to simulate and thermodynamically calculate water clusters, liquid water, and aqueous solutions with explicit solvent.@en
A shell script used in Amber molecular dynamics workflows. It automates common tasks in Amber simulations.@en

Electrostatic interaction computing method is a method to handle electrostatic interactions. Electrostatic interaction is a long-range, attractive or repulsive forces between charged particles or molecules governed by Coulomb's law.@en

Encounter complex ligand state is an initial, loosely bound complex formed when the ligand first comes into contact with the protein. This state often involves non-specific interactions and precedes the formation of the final, stable bound state.@en
A comprehensive molecular modeling and drug design software suite. It provides tools for building, visualizing, and analyzing molecular structures.@en
Generalized Born Surface Area, another method for calculating solvation free energies. It's generally faster than PBSA but may be less accurate for some systems.@en

Disulfide bridges are covalent bonds formed between the thiol groups (-SH) of two cysteine residues in proteins. These bonds play a crucial role in stabilizing protein tertiary and quaternary structures. In molecular dynamics simulations, disulfide bridges are usually modeled as covalent bonds, but their formation or breaking can be simulated in some advanced applications.@en
A technique used to analyze data from molecular simulations using statistical principles. These methods help extract meaningful information from large datasets generated by simulations.@en
A suite of programs for molecular dynamics simulations. It's widely used for simulations of biomolecules, particularly proteins and nucleic acids.@en

The initial setup phase of a molecular simulation, involving system construction and parameter assignment. This includes building molecular structures, defining force fields, and setting initial conditions.@en
A script used to automate repetitive tasks in molecular simulations. These scripts can manage entire simulation workflows, from system setup to analysis.@en
Implicit solvent model is a solvent model treat the solvent as a continuous medium rather than individual molecules.@en
Ligand pairs are selected based on structural similarity.@en
Ligand charge model is a model or combination of QM-MM based models used for calculating the charges of specific molecular entities.@en
Metrics used to quantify the similarity or difference between datasets or distributions. These are crucial for comparing different simulations or experimental results.@en
Lipid17 is a lipid force filed type available under AMBER software package (2017).@en
Protein Data Bank, a file format for representing molecular structures. It's widely used for sharing and storing 3D structural data of biological molecules.@en

Langevin-piston barostat is based on Langevin thermostat with an additional damping (friction) force and stochastic force are introduced. Random collisions eliminate oscillation of the volume associated with the piston mass.@en
The criteria on how ligand pairs are selected.@en
Tool used for trajectory post-processing and analysis.@en

Transition ligand state is a high-energy, unstable configuration that represents the point of highest free energy along the reaction coordinate of ligand binding or unbinding. It's a fleeting state that determines the rate of binding/unbinding processes.@en
General AMBER force field 2 (gaff2) is a Small Organic Molecule Force Field designed for small organic molecules, compatible with AMBER protein force fields.@en
The actual running of a molecular simulation on a computer or cluster. It involves solving equations of motion for atoms over time, often for nanoseconds to microseconds of simulated time.@en
Software that is operated through text commands in a console. Many molecular simulation tools are command-line programs, allowing for scripting and automation.@en
Bootstrapping is a resampling technique used to estimate confidence intervals and assess the robustness of results.@en
Water type is the specific water model type used to represent water molecules, designed to mimic the behavior of real water in simulations.@en
Interaction type is the type of interaction described by the chemical  force-fields between two chemical entities.@en

Solvated ligand state is the configuration where the ligand is completely surrounded by solvent molecules (typically water) and fully hydrated. This state is important for understanding the energetics of desolvation during binding.@en
A specific measure of rank correlation. It's used to assess the ordinal association between two quantities.@en

pyMBAR is a Python implementation of the Multistate Bennett Acceptance Ratio (MBAR) method. MBAR is a statistical technique used to estimate free energies and expectation values from multiple equilibrium states in molecular simulations. pyMBAR provides a set of tools to perform these calculations on simulation data.@en
Ligand protonation software predicts the aqueous phase pKa values and protonation state distributions of complex, drug-like molecules.@en
Quantum Mechanics basis set is a set of functions used to create molecular orbitals to perform quantum chemistry calculations on atoms and molecules.@en

The substance or molecular system being studied in a simulation, which can include salt, proteins, nucleic acids, small molecules, lipids, or their combinations. Materials in molecular simulations are represented by atomic coordinates and parameters that define their behavior.@en
Measures of the direct relationship between an observation and its lag. They help in identifying the order of an auto-regressive model.@en

Optimal transformation path algorithm is an algorithm to find the most efficient way to transform one molecule into another in the context of free energy calculations, particularly in methods like thermodynamic integration or free energy perturbation.@en
Measures used to quantify the similarity between different molecular conformations or states. These metrics help in understanding the conformational space sampled in simulations.@en

Parrinello-Rahman is a type of barostat algorithm in which the system is couplet to a pressure bath, allowing to change the shape  and size of the box known as an anisotropic deformation of the box.@en
A user-friendly application for analyzing protein structures. It allows visualization and manipulation of 3D protein structures from PDB files.@en
Reaction Field (RF) is a method to simulate the effect of long-range dipole-dipole interactions when using periodic boundaries conditions.@en
Monte Carlo barostat is a type of barostat algorithm that  samples rigorously from the isobaric-isothermal ensemble and does not necessitate computing the virial.@en
Backbone hydrogen bonds are hydrogen bonds generated between backbone atoms in a polypeptidic chain.@en

Canonical ensemble or NVT ensemble  is a statistical ensemble that is used to study material properties under the conditions of a constant particle number N, constant volume V and a temperature fluctuating around an equilibrium value.@en-au
MMPBSA Module is a module that can calculate MMPBSA calculation.@en
Hamiltonian replica exchange approach combines thermodynamic integration with replica exchange to enhance sampling.@en-au
The process of allowing a system to reach a stable state before data collection in a simulation. It ensures that the system's properties are no longer changing systematically.@en
Pearson's correlation coefficient (r) measures the linear correlation between predicted and experimental values. It ranges from -1 to 1, with 1 indicating perfect positive correlation.@en
Dice Coefficient metric emphasize the importance of shared features, often used in text mining and information retrieval.@en
Software used to estimate the binding free energy between molecules. These tools employ various computational methods to predict how strongly molecules interact.@en
Predictive Index (PI) measures the ability of the method to rank compounds by their binding affinity correctly. It is particularly useful in drug discovery applications.@en
Tool to compute free energy workflow,@en
KCl or Potassium Chloride consists of potassium (K+) and chloride (Cl-) ions in a 1:1 ratio.@en
GAMESS is a general ab initio quantum chemistry package.@en
The approach used to perform thermodynamics integration.@en

Kullback-Leibler divergence metric (relative entropy) is a statistical measurement from information theory that is commonly used to quantify the difference between one probability distribution from a reference probability distribution.@en
Block Averaging estimates statistical inefficiency and provides error bars for correlated time series data. It is particularly useful for molecular dynamics simulations.@en
Ligand pairs are selected from ligands that are representative of classical drug discovery targets and chemistries.@en

Thermodynamic Integration Without Linear Extrapolation is a method that calculates free energy differences between states by integrating over ensemble-averaged enthalpy changes along a defined thermodynamic path. It is more conservative and can be more accurate for large changes in thermodynamic variables, though it often converges more slowly than extrapolation approaches.@en
A technique for combining data from multiple simulations. It's often used to calculate free energy profiles from umbrella sampling simulations.@en

Prim's algorithm is a method for finding the minimum spanning tree (MST) of a weighted, undirected graph.  A minimum spanning tree is a subset of edges that connects all vertices with the minimum total edge weight.@en
Pearson correlation measures linear correlation between two sets of data, can be applied to various molecular properties.@en
Software utilities used to perform specific tasks in molecular simulations. These can range from file format converters to specialized analysis programs.@en
A type of microscopy where samples are studied at cryogenic temperatures. It allows for high-resolution imaging of biomolecules in their native state.@en

A comprehensive molecular similarity measure that combines both shape-based RefTversky and chemical feature-based RefColorTversky scores into a single metric. This combined measure provides a more complete assessment of molecular similarity by considering both geometric shape and chemical functionality simultaneously. The resulting score typically ranges from 0 to 2, though it can occasionally exceed this range due to the field-based nature of shape matching.@en

ROCS is a computational tool for 3D molecular comparison that employs Gaussian functions to represent molecular shape and chemical features. It aligns molecules by optimizing volume and feature overlap, enabling shape-based virtual screening in drug discovery.@en
Poisson-Boltzmann Surface Area, a method for calculating solvation free energies. It uses a continuum model to represent the solvent.@en
Protein force field is the force field being used to model proteins in simulations.@en

Excited states are higher energy electronic configurations of a ligand where electrons occupy orbitals above the ground state. These states are crucial in photochemical processes and spectroscopic studies, representing temporary, energetically elevated molecular arrangements.@en
In Langevin thermostat, at each time step, all particles receive a random force and have their velocities lowered using a constant friction.@en
A file specifying parameters and conditions for Amber molecular dynamics simulations. It contains instructions for how the simulation should be run.@en

Trajectory approach describe how MD trajectories are generated and utilized to calculate binding free energies in methods like MM-PBSA or MM-GBSA. The approach determines which molecular systems are simulated and how the data from these simulations is used in the calculations.@en

All-Atom molecular dynamics is a computational simulation technique that models the behavior and interactions of all atoms in a molecular system over time by solving Newton's equations of motion. All-atoms MD uses empirical force fields or inter-atomic potentials to calculate the forces between atoms and their potential energies.@en
PACKMOL-Memgen is a software to create virtual models of cell membranes with proteins embedded in the cell membranes.@en
A specific statistical test used to compare distributions in molecular simulation data. It assesses whether two datasets differ significantly in their distribution.@en
A computational representation of a molecular system used in simulations. It includes the molecular structure, force field parameters, and environmental conditions.@en
Jaccard index measures similarity between finite sample sets, similar to Tanimoto but for discrete data.@en
A force field used in molecular dynamics simulations, particularly for biomolecules. It defines parameters for how atoms interact and is widely used for protein and lipid simulations.@en

Protonation tool is a tool  that prepares structures for further calculations by reconstructing missing atoms, adding hydrogens, assigning atomic charges and radii from specified force fields, and generating PQR files.@en
In molecular dynamics, trajectory file is a file containing the 3D atom coordinates across time for a pre-determined molecular system.@en
A specific force field used in molecular dynamics simulations, particularly for proteins. It defines how atoms interact and is known for improved accuracy in protein structure prediction.@en
Ligand pairs are selected from ligands that are known to be stable in MD simulations.@en
Extended thermodynamic integration approach allows prediction of λ derivatives at non-simulated points. It can be used to optimize the parameterization of H(λ) for smoother ⟨∂H/∂λ⟩ curves.@en
Predictive Index (PI) measures the ability of the method to correctly rank compounds by their binding affinity. It is particularly useful in drug discovery applications.@en

AmberTools consists of several independently developed packages that work well by themselves, and with Amber24. The suite can also be used to carry out complete molecular dynamics simulations, with either explicit water or generalized Born solvent models.@en

Conformational ligand state is different three-dimensional arrangements of the ligand's atoms that can interconvert. These can include folded vs. extended states, or different rotamers of flexible groups.@en

Alchemical free energy calculations model the physically impossible but computationally realizable process of gradually mutating a subset of atoms of a system from one state to another, through a series of intermediate steps.@en
Unique codes or names used to identify specific molecules or structures. These are crucial for organizing and retrieving data in large databases.@en
ChronusQ is a production quantum chemistry software package written in C++11 specializing in electronic dynamics and relativistic effects in molecular quantum mechanics.@en
Statistical methods for making decisions based on sample data. These are used to assess the significance of observed differences or trends in simulation results.@en

A comprehensive molecular similarity measure that combines FitTversky shape matching with FitColorTversky chemical feature matching into a single metric. This measure emphasizes the database (fit) molecule's characteristics through its high β parameter value (0.95), making it particularly useful for identifying compounds where the query molecule is a substructure of database molecules. Like RefTverskyCombo, it produces scores typically ranging from 0 to 2, providing a balanced assessment of both geometric shape and chemical functionality similarities.@en
A ligand state refers to a specific configuration or condition of a ligand molecule in the context of its interaction with a target protein or other biomolecules.@en

Constraining algorithm is a method used to maintain certain geometric properties of the simulated system, typically bond lengths or angles, at fixed values. It is used to remove high-frequency vibrations, allowing for larger time steps in simulations or maintain specific molecular geometries or structural features.@en
TIP3P is a water force-field type. It specifies a 3-site rigid water molecule with charges and Lennard-Jones parameters assigned to each of the 3 atoms.@en

Dual-Topology approach allows for the simultaneous presence of both end states in the system. It is useful for relative binding free energy calculations, and used in TIES (Thermodynamic Integration with Enhanced Sampling).@en
Rectangular/cubic is a box-shaped simulation space, the most common and simple shape used for containing the molecular system.@en

PDB2PQR is a software to prepare and optimize molecular structures prior to biomolecular simulations based on filling in missing parts, adding hydrogen, assigning charges and radii, and generate PQR files.@en
CPPTRAJ is the main program in Amber for processing coordinate trajectories and data files.@en
A force field is a mathematical expression describing the dependence of the energy of a system on. the coordinates of its particles.@en
Hydrogen bond is the interaction involving a hydrogen atom located between a pair of other atoms having a high affinity for electrons@en
Lipid14 is a lipid force filed type available under AMBER software package (2014).@en
1-step soft-core approach allows changing charges and van der Waals interactions in a single simulation. It is used soft-core potentials to avoid singularities when particles appear/disappear.@en
Short programs written to automate tasks in molecular simulations. They often combine multiple tools or programs to perform complex workflows.@en
Specialized computer programs used to perform molecular simulations and analyze results. These include molecular dynamics engines, visualization tools, and data analysis packages, and others.@en
A specific dimensionality reduction technique often used in molecular simulation analysis. PCA identifies the main axes of variation in a dataset.@en
A method used to control temperature in molecular dynamics simulations. It adjusts particle velocities to maintain a desired temperature, simulating a system's interaction with a heat bath.@en

LINCS is an algorithm that resets bonds to their correct lengths after an unconstrained update. The method is non-iterative, as it always uses two steps. Although LINCS is based on matrices, no matrix-matrix multiplications are needed.@en
Explicit solvent model is solvent model that treat solvent molecules explicitly, including their coordinates and degrees of freedom.@en
Optimal Point Charges Model (OPM) is a water type model  designed without geometrical restraints. Considerably better reproduces the six bulk properties of water.@en
A script written for a specific purpose in a molecular simulation project. These often implement novel analysis methods or automate project-specific workflows.@en
Gravitational interaction energy is an attraction, the force of interaction being proportional to the product of the masses of the chemical entities.@en
TI calculation computes the free energy difference between two states A and B by coupling them via a parameter λ that serves as an additional, non-spatial coordinate.@en
In data mining and statistics, hierarchical clustering is a method of cluster analysis that seeks to build a hierarchy of clusters.@en
Error metrics are statistical measures used to assess the accuracy, precision, and reliability of the computational predictions compared to experimental values.@en
Electrostatic interactions are forces between nearby atoms and molecules. Like charges will repel one another and opposite charges will attract.@en
Similarity calculation metric is a metric that describe the level of similarity/dissimilarity necessary for two members to be in the same cluster.@en

Thermodynamic Integration With Linear Extrapolation is a method that uses linear extrapolation to predict properties at new thermodynamic states, often accurately over limited ranges, and is computationally more efficient than running new simulations for each state. In some systems, such as water, it can accurately extrapolate across the entire liquid state.@en
p-value represents the likelihood of obtaining your observed results if the null hypothesis (the assumption that there's no real effect or difference) were true.@en
A script that outlines and executes a series of tasks in a molecular simulation project. It orchestrates the entire process from system preparation to final analysis.@en
Key metrics used to evaluate the accuracy of ΔΔG predictions in computational chemistry and drug discovery.@en
Berendsen thermostat samples canonical distribution by scaling all velocities to a random temperature probed from canonical distribution.@en
The structure and organization of data files used in molecular simulations. Common formats include PDB for structures and XTC for trajectories.@en
In molecular simulation, a process is a sequence of computational steps to model molecular behavior. It typically includes system preparation, simulation execution, and data analysis.@en
Euclidean disteance sums the absolute differences of coordinates, also known as city block distance or L1 norm.@en
Tanimoto Combo Score is a ROCS score that includes the shape score for similarity and the color score for similarity.@en
Quantum Mechanics Software is software tools used for quantum mechanics calculations in computational chemistry.@en
Ligand pairs are selected by considering the computational cost and selecting a manageable number of ligands.@en

Spearman's rank correlation coefficient assesses how well the predicted rankings of compounds match the experimental rankings. It is useful when the relative ordering of compounds is more important than absolute values.@en
Tools used to prepare molecular structures for simulations or analysis. These typically handle tasks like adding hydrogen atoms, assigning charges, and fixing structural issues.@en
Ensemble is a statistical collection of possible states that a system can occupy under specific thermodynamic conditions.@en
Programs that use classical mechanics to model molecular systems. They treat atoms as spheres and bonds as springs, ignoring quantum effects.@en
The tunnel predictor tool allows the identification of surface-exposed as well as hidden tunnels across MD simulation ensembles.@en
Ligand pairs are selected from ligands with high-quality protein-ligand complex structures (e.g., low B-factors, high resolution).@en

Tautomeric state is the state where structural isomers of the ligand are ready to interconvert, and differ in the position of a proton and a double bond. Tautomers can have different binding properties and may interconvert during the binding process.@en
Root-Mean-Square Deviation (RMSD) is a commonly used measure to quantify the difference between two sets of values, often used to compare structures or assess the accuracy of predictions.@en
Methods used to assess the accuracy and reliability of simulation results. These often involve comparing simulations to experimental data or to higher-level theoretical calculations.@en
Nuclear interaction energy is the minimum energy that is required to disassemble the nucleus of an atom into its constituent protons and neutrons.@en
Organic molecules is the force field the force field being used to model organic molecules in simulations, including ligands.@en

The examination and interpretation of data produced by molecular simulations. This includes calculating various properties, visualizing trajectories, and extracting meaningful insights from the simulation results.@en
A file describing the molecular structure and force field parameters in Amber. It defines how atoms are connected and interact in the simulation.@en
Hydrogen bonds generated between side chain and backbone atoms in a polypeptidic chain.@en
Short-range interaction is the type of interaction that take place under a specific distance cut-off (e.g. ionic, covalent, metallic, dipolar).@en
Hexagonal prism is simulation space in the form of hexagonal prism.@en
Long-range interaction is the type of intereraction that take still place beyond of a specific distance cut-off (e.g. van der Waals, Hydrogen bond).@en
memembed is a software to determine the membrane proteins orientation inside cell membranes/lipid bilayers.@en
NWChem is an ab initio computational chemistry software package which includes quantum chemical and molecular dynamics functionality.@en

Microcanonical ensemble or NVE is a statistical ensemble that is used to study material properties under the conditions of a constant particle number N, constant volume V and total energy fluctuating around an equilibrium value.@en

Auto-correlation Analysis measures how long it takes for a system to lose memory of its initial state. It is important for assessing sampling quality and determining statistically independent samples.@en
Methods to predict interactions between molecules without dynamics. These often use simplified models to quickly estimate binding affinities.@en

In the Andersen thermostat scheme, some prescribed number of particles is selected, and their momenta (actually, their velocities) are drawn from a Gaussian distribution at the prescribed temperature.@en
Lipid21 is a lipid force filed type available under AMBER software package (2022).@en

A covalent interaction, also known as a covalent bond, is a strong chemical bond that involves the sharing of electron pairs between atoms. In molecular dynamics simulations, covalent bonds are typically represented as rigid or semi-rigid connections between atoms, often modeled using harmonic potentials. These bonds are crucial for maintaining the primary structure of molecules like proteins and nucleic acids.@en

Ligand pairs are selected from ligands with well-defined stereochemistry, tautomeric states, and protonation states. This include ligands within the domain of applicability of the computational method being used.@en
A file format in Amber molecular dynamics software containing atomic coordinates. It represents the 3D positions of atoms in a molecular system.@en
Techniques used to determine the three-dimensional structure of proteins. These include experimental methods like X-ray crystallography and computational methods like homology modeling.@en
Truncated octahedron is a 8-sided and space-filling shape.@en
A file allowing a molecular dynamics simulation to be continued from a previous point. It contains the system's state at a specific time in the simulation.@en
A collection of atomic radii used in implicit solvent calculations. The choice of radii can significantly affect the results of solvation free energy calculations.@en
ORCA is a powerful and versatile quantum chemistry software package, primarily developed by the group of Prof. Frank Neese.@en
Dijkstra's algorithm finds the shortest path between nodes in a graph, and can be adapted for finding optimal transformation paths.@en

Multi-state Bennett Acceptance Ratio (MBAR) uses data from simulations at multiple thermodynamic states, provides optimal estimates of free energy differences, and able estimate expectations of observables.@en
Hysteresis measures the difference between forward and backward transformations in alchemical free energy calculations. It indicates the extent of sampling problems.@en
Methods for calculating entropic contributions to free energies. These are important for accurately predicting binding affinities and conformational preferences.@en

A set of computational rules or procedures used to solve problems or perform tasks, including those in molecular simulations. Examples include integration algorithms for updating atomic positions and velocities.@en
A method used to extract meaningful information from molecular simulation data. This can include statistical analysis, pattern recognition, or machine learning approaches.@en
Combo score is a customizable combination of shape and color scores, allows users to define their own weighting scheme.@en

A molecular similarity measure that compares two molecular structures by calculating their overlap while allowing asymmetric weighting through parameters α and β. The measure ranges from 0 (completely different) to 1 (identical), and can be adjusted to emphasize either the reference or query molecule in the comparison. It is particularly useful in molecular screening as it can identify both substructure and superstructure relationships between molecules.@en

Solvation model allows the quantum chemistry calculations to include the interactions between solvents and the quantum solute. Solvents can be treated implicitly, known as continuum solvents, and explicitly.@en
A procedure used to determine if a hypothesis about molecular simulation data is supported by evidence. It involves comparing observed data to expected outcomes under specific assumptions.@en
Software used to create initial structures for molecular simulations. It defines the connectivity of atoms and their initial positions.@en
Hamming distance counts the number of positions at which corresponding symbols in two strings are different, used for comparing binary fingerprints.@en
CAVER is a software tool for analysis and visualization of tunnels and channels in protein structures.@en
Protein structure is a protein 3D atom coordinates file coming from a structure prediction job, cryo-EM microscopy or X-ray.@en
Statistical methods to assess the strength and significance of linear relationships between variables. It's used to evaluate the reliability of correlations in data analysis.@en
Statistical methods for estimating relationships among variables. In molecular simulations, it's often used to relate structural features to functional properties.@en
Carbohydrates force field is the force field being used to model carbohydrates in simulations.@en
A file format for representing macro-molecular structure data. It's more detailed and flexible than the older PDB format.@en
3-trajectory approach uses separate trajectories for the complex, receptor (protein), and ligand.@en

Kruskal's algorithm finds a minimum spanning forest of an undirected edge-weighted graph. If the graph is connected, it finds a minimum spanning tree. It is a greedy algorithm that in each step adds to the forest the lowest-weight edge that will not form a cycle.@en

A peptidic bond, also called a peptide bond, is a specific type of covalent bond that forms between the carboxyl group of one amino acid and the amino group of another amino acid. This bond is crucial in forming the primary structure of proteins. In molecular dynamics simulations, peptide bonds are usually treated as rigid planar units due to their partial double bond character.@en
π–π interaction is a particular type of dispersion force from van der Waals forces, which is established between unsaturated (poly)cyclic molecules.@en
Root Mean Square Fluctuation  (RMSF) measures the average deviation of a particle from its mean position. It is used to characterize local changes along the protein chain.@en
A specific set of atomic radii used in molecular simulations. It's based on van der Waals radii and is widely used in computational chemistry.@en
Files generated by Amber during and after a molecular dynamics simulation. These contain various data about the system's behavior over time.@en
The process of adding or removing protons (hydrogens) to atoms or molecules in a simulation system. It's crucial for accurately representing the chemical state of molecules at a given pH.@en
Overlap coefficient measures the overlap between two sets, useful when one set is a subset of the other.@en

Standard thermodynamic integration approach uses a coupling parameter λ to gradually transform one state into another. It requires multiple simulations at different λ values and integrates ⟨∂H/∂λ⟩ over λ to obtain the free energy difference.@en

Particle-Particle Particle-Mesh (P3M) is a method to compute electrostatic energy and forces, setting EPB in the output to zero and EEL that includes both the reaction field energy and the Coulombic energy.@en
Jensen-Shannon and Kullback-Leibler Divergences measure differences between probability distributions, useful for comparing conformational ensembles.@en
Ligand pairs are selected based on ligand efficiency metrics to guide the selection and optimization of fragment hits in fragment-based drug discovery.@en
The process of creating visual representations of molecular structures and simulation results. It helps in understanding complex 3D structures and their dynamics.@en

A statistical approach to determine the significance of results. The p-value indicates the probability of obtaining results at least as extreme as those observed, assuming the null hypothesis is true.@en
Manhattan distance measures the cosine of the angle between two vectors, often used in high-dimensional spaces.@en
Quantum Mechanical Solvent Model is a solvent model that is based on QM-calculations.@en
Epik is a tool for accurately and rapidly predicting the aqueous phase pKa values and protonation state distributions of complex, drug-like molecules.@en
QuTiP is open-source software for simulating the dynamics of open quantum systems.@en
Side chain hydrogen bonds are hydrogen bonds generated between side chain atoms in a polypeptidic chain.@en
Simulation type is the type of molecular dynamics simulation being conducted.@en
Box type is  the 3D-shape of simulation space used to contain the molecular system.@en
The main phase of a molecular dynamics simulation where data is collected. This phase follows system preparation and equilibration.@en
A method for analyzing vibrational modes in molecular systems. It can be used to estimate entropic contributions to free energies.@en
The software used for performing in-silico mutagenesis of target proteins of interest. Different softwares are available on the market to fulfill this task.@en
A simplified molecular dynamics approach where groups of atoms are treated as single particles. It allows simulation of larger systems or longer timescales than all-atom models.@en
Machine learning solvent model is a solvent model based on machine-learning approaches.@en
Binding free energy calculation method is an advanced techniques that involve QM-MM on MD simulations ensembles for extracting binding free energy properties.@en
A method used to group similar molecular conformations. It helps in identifying dominant structures or states in a simulation trajectory.@en
Single-Topology approach transforms one molecule into another by changing atom types and parameters. It is used as an alternative to dual-topology.@en
Ligand pairs are selected based on the diverse chemical structures and properties to cover a wide range of interactions. This include ligands with different functional groups, sizes, and shapes.@en
1-trajectory approach uses a single trajectory of the protein-ligand complex.@en
Molpro is a comprehensive system of ab initio programs for advanced molecular electronic structure calculations.@en
A variant of the Generalized Born model for implicit solvation calculations. It's used in some molecular dynamics simulations and free energy calculations.@en
Optimization of Alchemical Pathways approach focuses on finding optimal λ schedules or H(λ) parameterizations for more efficient sampling.@en
Parameters used to describe the behavior of ions in molecular simulations. These include charge, size, and interaction energies with other atoms.@en
A method used to determine the atomic and molecular structure of a crystal. It's widely used to solve protein structures by analyzing X-ray diffraction patterns.@en
A method used to calculate free energy differences along a reaction coordinate. It involves running multiple simulations with restraints to sample high-energy regions.@en
Simulated Annealing algorithm provides a probabilistic technique for approximating the global optimum. It can escape local minima in complex optimization landscapes.@en
A technique that uses magnetic properties of atomic nuclei to determine molecular structure. It's particularly useful for studying protein dynamics in solution.@en
A specific thermostat algorithm used in molecular dynamics. It introduces an additional degree of freedom to the system to maintain constant temperature.@en

tleap is used to prepare molecular systems for simulation, including generating topology and coordinate files needed to run molecular dynamics. Tleap loads molecular structures (e.g., from PDB files), applies force field parameters, adds solvent and ions, sets up periodic boundary conditions, and generates AMBER topology (.prmtop) and coordinate (.inpcrd) files, all of which are essential steps in preparing molecular systems for simulation.@en

Bennett Acceptance Ratio (BAR) estimates free energy differences between two states, minimizes statistical error in free energy estimates,  and iteratively solves for the free energy difference. It is more efficient than simple free energy perturbation methods.@en
Ligand pairs are selected from pairs that represent specific structural changes, such as: a) Charge changes, b) Ring size modifications, c) Linker changes, and d) Binding mode alterations.@en

Non-covalent interactions is the type of interaction that differs from covalent bonds in that it does not involve the sharing of electrons, but rather involves more dispersed variations of electromagnetic interactions between molecules or within a molecule.@en
Molecular Mechanics Generalized Born Surface Area, similar to MMPBSA but using a different solvation model. It's generally faster but may be less accurate for some systems.@en
Ligand pairs are selected based on  the range of binding affinities to the target protein. Include both strong and weak binders to assess the method's ability to discriminate.@en
Software used to create visual representations of molecular structures and simulation results. These tools help in understanding complex 3D structures and their dynamics.@en

Andersen barostat is a type of barostat algorithm in which  the system is coupled to a pressure bath, and the coupling is achieved by including an additional degree of freedom in the equations of motion. This mathematical artifact mimics the action of a piston scaling the volume of the system.@en
A popular water model used in molecular dynamics simulations. It represents water molecules with three interaction sites, balancing accuracy and computational efficiency.@en
A molecular dynamics package primarily designed for bio-molecular systems. It's known for its high performance and is widely used in the scientific community.@en

Other organic molecule force field is the force field being used to model ligands in simulations / The set of parameters and equations used to model the interactions and behavior of small molecules (ligands) that bind to proteins or other biomolecules.@en

Grand canonical ensemble, or MuVT (µVT), is an ensemble with a constant chemical potential (μ), volume (V), and temperature (T). In this ensemble, the system can exchange both energy and particles.@en
Conveyor Belt Thermodynamic Integration (CBTI) approach is a newer method that uses multiple replicas moving in a coordinated fashion along λ.@en
Nearest-neighbor algorithm works by making a greedy approach that always chooses the closest unvisited node. This is simple but may not always find the optimal solution.@en
A method to simplify complex data from molecular simulations by reducing the number of variables. It helps in visualizing and analyzing high-dimensional data.@en
Software used to examine and interpret data from molecular simulations. This can include programs for calculating various properties or identifying important events in simulations.@en
LIE estimates binding free energy based on changes in electrostatic and vdW interaction energies between bound and unbound states using MD simulation snapshots.@en
Type of interaction that take place between induced electrical forces between two or more atoms or molecules that are very close to each other.@en
Antechamber is a set of auxiliary programs for molecular mechanic (MM) studies.@en
Statistical measure used specifically for computational methods.@en
Computational methods to predict how two proteins bind together. It aims to determine the most likely orientation and conformation of protein complexes.@en
A script used to perform specific analyses on molecular simulation data. These often combine multiple analysis tools or implement custom calculations.@en
Linear dependence evaluation method is used to measure how the degree of linear dependence between experimental and computed binding free energies was evaluated.@en
Various mathematical methods used in molecular simulation analysis. These can range from simple statistical measures to complex machine learning algorithms.@en
A molecular visualization system for rendering and animating 3D molecular structures. It's widely used for creating high-quality molecular graphics.@en
Numerical integration is a mathematical method often used to compute the integral over the thermodynamic path.@en
A systematic procedure for performing a molecular simulation or analysis. This can include specific algorithms, protocols, or techniques used to study molecular systems.@en
A specific set of ion parameters used in molecular simulations. It's designed to accurately represent the behavior of metal ions in bio-molecular systems.@en

TI extrapolation is a method that combines thermodynamic integration with extrapolation techniques to estimate thermodynamic properties or structural observables at conditions different from those directly simulated, based on statistical mechanical relationships that provide estimates of derivatives of properties with respect to thermodynamic variables (e.g., temperature, volume). It can reduce computational cost in mapping phase and structural transitions.@en
Quantum Mechanics-Molecular Mechanics-based method is a method to determine electronic structures and atoms-molecules connectivity.@en

Cation–π interaction is a non-covalent molecular interaction between the face of an electron-rich π system (e.g. benzene, ethylene, acetylene) and an adjacent cation (e.g. Li+, Na+). This interaction is an example of non-covalent bonding between a monopole (cation) and a quadrupole (π system).@en
RNA force field is the force field being used to model RNAs in simulations@en
A file containing instructions for the tleap program in Amber. It's used to prepare system topologies and coordinate files for Amber simulations.@en

Restrained Electrostatic Potential fitting approach is an established means for placing partial charges on atoms at the right intensities to mimic the electrostatic field outside of the molecular surface.@en
The Predictive Index (PI) of Pearman is a statistical measure used to evaluate the performance of computational methods for predicting protein-ligand binding affinities.@en
Free-energy differences statistical method is an advanced statistical methods used in computational chemistry and physics for estimating free energy differences.@en

RATTLE is the velocity version of SHAKE which is a popular algorithm for introducing distance constraints during molecular dynamics simulations. The RATTLE procedure is to go through the constraints one by one, adjusting the coordinates so as to satisfy each in turn.@en
A particular configuration or condition of a molecular system at a given time in a simulation. It includes atomic positions, velocities, and other relevant parameters.@en
Hybrid solvent model is a solvent model that combine aspects of both explicit and implicit models.@en

MMGBSA (Molecular Mechanics Generalized Born Surface Area) is a computational method for estimating binding free energies in molecular systems, particularly protein-ligand interactions. It combines molecular mechanics calculations with the Generalized Born model for implicit solvation, offering a faster but potentially less accurate alternative to MMPBSA..@en
FoldX evaluates in-silico mutants by evaluating the difference in protein folding free energy between wild-type and a mutant of interest.@en
AM1BCC is a program that assigns atom types and bond types according to AM1-BCC definitions and then does bond charge correction.@en
A file recording the positions of all atoms over time in a molecular dynamics simulation. It's used for analyzing the dynamic behavior of molecules.@en
Tool used to calculate TI similarity.@en
Electromagnetic interaction energy is an interaction energy that exists between electrically charged particles and bodies through an electromagnetic field.@en
A statistical method for analyzing conformational dynamics in molecular simulations. MSMs represent the system as a network of states with transition probabilities between them.@en

PROPKA is  a software to predict the pKa values of ionizable groups in protein and protein ligands complexes; enable the understanding of the behavior of proteins or other biological molecules in different environments.@en

Free-energy perturbation (FEP) is a method based on statistical mechanics that is used in computational chemistry for computing free-energy differences from molecular dynamics or Metropolis Monte Carlo simulations.@en
NaCl or Sodium Chloride consists of sodium (Na+) and chloride (Cl-) ions in a 1:1 ratio.@en

Single trajectory approach in molecular dynamics simulations refers to a method where only one simulation of the complex (e.g. protein-ligand bound state) is performed, rather than separate simulations of the complex, protein, and ligand.@en
A tool used to assign protonation states to molecules in simulations. It's crucial for accurately representing the chemical state of molecules at a given pH.@en
A Python script for performing MMPBSA calculations in Amber. It automates the process of calculating binding free energies from molecular dynamics trajectories.@en
Rhombic dodecahedron uses a 12-sided, space-filling shape. Considered to be more efficient than a cube.@en
Clustering analysis groups similar conformations to identify representative structures and analyze conformational diversity.@en
Chemistry at HARvard Molecular Mechanics, a molecular simulation program. It includes both a molecular dynamics engine and its own force field.@en
Software that has been converted from source code into machine code for execution. Compiled programs often run faster than interpreted scripts.@en
Integration method is the general category of methods used to compute free energy differences (ΔG) in molecular systems.@en
CaCl2 or Calcium Chloride consists of calcium (Ca2+) and chloride (Cl-) ions in a 1:2 ratio.@en
Membrane packing software builds membrane-protein–lipid-bilayer systems.@en
Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale.@en
Binding Free-Energy Estimator 2 uses a rigorous statistical mechanical framework , suitable for a broad range of protein-ligand complexes and aims for chemical accuracy in a matter of days.@en
Genetic algorithms uses evolutionary principles to optimize the transformation path and can handle complex optimization problems but may be computationally intensive.@en
Software used to change file formats in molecular simulation workflows. These tools are crucial for interoperability between different simulation and analysis programs.@en
ff14SB is a protein force-field type, compatible with TIP3P water model.@en
Q-Chem is an ab initio quantum chemistry software package for fast and accurate simulations of molecular systems.@en
Barostat is an algorithm used to control and maintain the pressure of a simulated system, typically work by adjusting the volume of the simulation box to maintain the desired pressure.@en

Isothermal-isobaric ensemble or NPT is a statistical ensemble that is used to study material properties under the conditions of a constant particle number N, constant pressure P and a temperature fluctuating around an equilibrium value.@en
